review_title: Riddled with political baggage, expectedly bureaucratic, sometimes unfriendly, but great benefits & good overall.
pros: My supervisor is incredibly flexible with scheduling, I have great benefits and pretty good pay compared to others in the area with the same job title.  The college is growing and turning into a 4-year school, so opportunities may be growing (assuming this darn recession lets up a bit).  Some of my co-workers are absolutely excellent people with good hearts and a desire to do right by students.
cons: It's horribly political.  So much of what I want to accomplish, so many of my innovative and/or common sense ideas are shot down with some sort of response like, "Well, that's just the way it is. Don't ask, it's political."  Administration seems to be so concerned with bringing in new money they don't stop to really assess the effectiveness and efficiency of things.  There are so many things that just don't make sense!  And it's been really hard to be a new person.  Most of the faculty and staff I've met just aren't friendly people.  Maybe it's that too many years there have made them calloused and bitter, but that's just not okay with me.  I've also been witness to some downright unethical stuff.  Yuck.

review_title: "Some good instructors but horrible International Student Programs"
pros: -Classes and instructions are great, you can generally expect that instructors are competent and motivated. You can count on them for support. Students work on so much stuff that there's always an opportunity to meet new friends.
cons:
-International Student Programs staff is the worse: their interest is your money and how much they can loot out of students, especially when students are almost at the end of their degree. They are well-trained and work in hands with the international health provider. International Students are not considered as students, just as good as credit cards.

-The director was contacted by international students but he did not provide a solution.

-Some Caucasians instructors cannot stand other than their type during class, yes there are discrimination.

-Management do not implement for themselves what instructors are teaching students.

pros: Bellevue College has a relaxed atmosphere that is also invigorating. Many of the students come from good socio-economic backgrounds and therefore do not have as many challenges to deal with as their inner-city peers.  Support staff at Bellevue College is fantastic! When any need arises, they are there for you.
cons: Bellevue College like almost all higher education institutions in America has been given impossible financial constraints to work with, therefore they do very little full-time hirings.  Office space and equipment is limited. As a part-timer you will need to share an office with at least one other part-timer.

job_title: Curriculum and Faculty Development Specialist in Bellevue, WA
pros: I felt like my work had a direct impact on students who were quickly changing their lives and getting meaningful education. Everyone was very committed to doing well by our students to make sure they would succeed in the workplace. Staff were also very cognizant of being good stewards of public money and resources.
cons: My work was terrifically siloed from other groups. I spent a year on campus and only interacted with a handful of people outside my immediate work group. This made it hard to transition to another role when my contract was up. It also made it hard to leverage existing resources on campus in my work.

review_title: BCC is a great place to work!
pros: The educational environment is stimulating and challenging, lots of energy, steady stream of new "customers" on a path to improve their lives, opportunity to be a part of others success, opportunity to further personal education at low cost, abundant opportunities for cultural education, sense of inclusion, welcoming environment for any and all people, emphasis on excellence, good sense of community, weathers economic downturns well, reasonable opportunities to advance or move within the organization, fabulous/generous benefits!
cons: Bureaucracy (red tape) of a public institution and propensity for being too politically correct, expectations and workloads continue to grow but staff size doesn't.

review_title: Lack of support from the Dean and administrators
pros: The opportunity to teach, inspire and foster positive values in our future generation.
cons: The Dean, administrators (HR, Public Safety, Care Team, Title IX), and the Union were only concerned about their image and reputation. They did NOT treat me fairly nor advocate for me when I was the victim of a sexual harassment case committed by a student.

job_title: Customer Service Specialist II in Tukwila, WA
pros: The people I worked with were all friendly and were fun to be around. We had our own office with cubes of just customer service specialists and was a relaxed environment. Good chances to move up (hire internally). Lots of room for growth
cons: Lots of drama between different departments. The management team seemed unorganized. Played a lot of favoritism and some people did not do their job since they are favored, which made others who got paid less work more. Seemed unethical.

review_title: Great diverse environment and student population but everything else about BC is not so great!
pros:
Working with students
Many friendly employees
Diverse campus
Discounted tuition for employees
cons:
Large educational institution that still gets bogged down by politics
Little to no collaboration between departments 
Everyone seems to be working in a silo 
Leadership is adrift
No recognition, no rewards
Accountability is an issue
Opportunities for raises and/or promotions are rare or nonexistent 
No career growth
Hiring process moves v-e-r-y- slowly
Expectations and workloads continue to grow but staff size doesn't

review_title: Love to work here but lots of turmoil
job_title: Classroom Support Technician in Bellevue, WA
pros: The culture is great, there's a lot of side opportunities and seminars to attend to not be bored, work is manageable
cons: Faculty have no supervision so they don't adhere to rules and laws, campus is dirty because of lack of custodians, No real support by HR so I don't go to them

review_title: BCC: Pays like a part-time-job, but academia is great.
pros: It is a College: pays like a part-time-job but our contract is 180 days per year. Teaching is Fun too. Academic freedom is a very good thing. Lively intellectual atmosphere.
cons: Pays like a part-time-job, not much room for advancement.

review_title: Great learning and networking opportunity. Unrealistic job expectations and difficult work environment.
pros:
Amazing networking opportunity and I learned tons. The job has some perks but most of it is publicity and a chance to be invited to all the "VIP" college events. The pays ok. Also very few students get to see behind the scenes of how a large college operates and be able to influence its direction.

Plus being able to play with a million or more dollars can be a great learning opportunity. If you do extremely well you will get recognition by members outside of your department which can open doors. 

Ultimately you just have to be happy that you are serving students and at the end of the day that's what makes it worth it.
cons:
Politics is the name of the game. Whether it's college politics, division, student programs or your teams politics it's going to take a toll on you if you don't enjoy it. Although it will even if you do. 

Student programs has had almost a full turnover of staff and is rather dysfunctional and messed up as a whole. Students vs employees takes on a whole new perspective. Honestly just a piece of advice know that the staff will be controlling and it's going tobsuck and occasionally they will be right but at the end of the day you need to remember that they have been there forever and so your new perspective on things might take awhile for them to accommodate and if your team is behind you then your solid.

To do most of the jobs right you will need to spend more like 40 or more hours so just figure out what standard you want to meet and stick to it. Many of us were so far past 40 hours we just stopped counting and we had plenty mpre work to do but it's really an individual choice.

The office environment is loud and lively but then again it is a bunch of students so might not be the best work place but it can be fun.

pros: My department sraff and mis the admin are amazing
cons: I have been an adjunct for over 8 years and I have never been treated as poorly by students as I have at Bellevue college. A good portion of them are great, but almost every quarter I end up with a handful that are absolutely horrible and make my life hell. It's been very difficult considering I have always loved teaching and felt very comfortable in the classroom. I can't really understand why it would be so different from my previous employers other than maybe social class/entitlement.

pros: The tutoring position was easy. You just answer student questions, and if there aren't any students, you can just do your homework. You aren't required to know the answers to all of their questions, so just answer the ones you know. In the summer it gets slow though, so it can be kind of boring.
cons: In the summer there weren't as many hours to go around as the tutoring center has shorter hours and some of the classes (like the Computer Science classes) are online only so students don't come in as much.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Bellevue, WA
pros: Wonderful Colleagues.  Amazing students, from all socio-economic levels.  Teaching at a community college is truly a privilege and an opportunity to change students' lives for the better.
cons: The legislature has not funded a step increase (increment) for SIX (6) years.  As a person who gives my all to students, this has been very discouraging.  However, we are hopeful that this is a changing as the economy is picking up across the state.

job_title: Systems Specialist V in Bellevue, WA
pros: Great immediate co-workers, sense of accomplishing something real. During my time there I had the opportunity to tackle a lot of great projects and was entrusted, and given the tools to do my job.
cons: High level of bureaucracy, politics and fiefdoms. In a state institution, not much you can do about those cons I think. Perhaps some day seniority can not be the prime reason for keeping your job.

pros: Very positive and welcoming environment, where supervisors welcome new ideas and accepts objective critiques. The building are very new and clean, computers and softwares are up to date
cons: Very small con is their canteen. The price of food there is very high, not like a college canteen, but some sort of restaurant prices, however food is good and they have lots of variety of food

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Bellevue, WA
pros: It paid. The people there were great.
cons: I just did not enjoy the job. Going in I expected campus security that walked the campus and checked doors and such. I guess I was surprised by the wanna be law enforcement outfits. Head supervisors wear badges on their belts like they are detectives for actual Police (minus a firearm). You are given uniform, with a utility belt, radio holder, belt keepers, pants, hat, badge, you could even wear an ear piece and I was offered a bulletproof vest (i chuckled). The whole time im thinking wow this is a little too far. I then worked a full shift which was doing fire checks every like half hour, walking around the campus pulling on doors, and trying to make my presence "known".  I guess I also do not understand security if you can not go hands on. Basically you're to just stand by if something real nasty happens and radio into "dispatch" to call the real police. I guess I did not stay around long enough to find out.

review_title: Okay if you know you're never equal
pros: State job, good benefits, higher education, giving back.
cons: Faculty are the king of the roost. You may have a lot to offer, but it's not as important to the college. While teaching is the reason college's came to be, every staff member is part of the educational experience and the team.
